subject: Re: Utter/Ado
msgSnippet: ... Eat+Ing ... become the ... 70 s, it ... approved. ... sure ... while I do ... created ... It s fantastic collecting the experiences of the last decades
messageBody:
--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "Moira O'Brien" <mj@...> wrote:
>
> On 24/11/2007, Anthony Grahn <othermale@...> wrote:
> >
> >
> > The rule: "use plain Ing for all cases everywhere of It+Ing and
Eat+Ing"
> > Is a proposal. It directly contradicts the QM but I too think it is
> > worth considering as it seems to solve a few problems.
> >
> > Similarly the rule: "use plain Ing for Ing+Gay" Is a proposal not seen
> > in the QM.
> >
> >
> >
> .
> >
>
> In practical application using Ing for all cases of It+Ing has
become the
> norm for me, and looking back on the correspondence of the 60's and
70's, it
> had become the norm then. So I think you can be assured that KR
approved.
>
> You must bear in mind that QM was never revised to incorporate the
> experience of the writing circle of that time. Had it been so, I am
sure
> that there would have been at least a few such amendments. So,
while I do
> take QM as being the bible, I also don't believe that the world was
created
> in seven days!
> _,_._,___
> Moira
>


It's fantastic collecting the experiences of the last decades along
with up-to-date linguistics to supplement an understanding of the QM.
Another burden, beyond figuring out what fixes are appropriate ( which
is certainly non-trivial ) is setting forth the arguments in a manner
so compelling that anyone hearing them is convinced by them.
